wikitext.*:
{{HoME3chapters}}
'''Poems Early Abandoned''' is the second chapter of ''[[The Lays of Beleriand]]''. During his time at the [[University of Leeds]] ([[1920]]-[[1925]]), Tolkien embarked on five poetic works concerned as part of his mythology, but only the ''[[Lay of Leithian]]'' and the ''[[Lay of the Children of Húrin]]'' were more than just beginnings.<ref>{{LB|2}}, p. 131</ref> This chapter treats in turn those abandoned poems.
